did.unittitle: Thomas Hegeman New Utrecht, New York Justice of the Peace papers
did.abstract: The papers span the period 1821 to 1828 and consist of a single bound volume containing Hegeman's handwritten notes detailing his tenure as Justice of the Peace in New Utrecht.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas Hegeman was a resident of New Utrecht, New York in the late eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries and was an active member of the town's public life. Hegeman served as Town Clerk of New Utrecht from 1797-1822; Constable in 1811; Deacon of the Dutch Reformed Church, 1798 and 1804; and Justice of the Peace, 1821-1828.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers span the period 1821 to 1828 and consist of a single bound volume containing Hegeman's handwritten notes detailing his tenure as Justice of the Peace in New Utrecht. The notes provide a wealth of information about the cases heard by Hegeman, including the date of each case, the persons involved, the charges brought before the court, witnesses, jury members, and the verdict reached.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1973.
